alert.note: Alert for Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 5:38PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Houston and southwestern Early Counties through 730 PM EDT/630 PM CDT/... At 638 PM EDT/538 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Ashford, or 14 miles northeast of Cottonwood, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cottonwood, Dothan, Taylor, Ashford, Cowarts, Webb, Columbia, Avon, Madrid, Gordon, Memphis, Pansey, Sigma, Enon, Wilson Mill, Barber, Keytons, Farley Nuclear Plant, Smyrna and Pearce. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
